content.question: Researchers are studying the distribution of subscribers to a certain streaming service in different populations. From a random sample of 200 people in City C, 34 were found to subscribe to the streaming service. From a random sample of 200 people in City K, 54 were found to subscribe to the streaming service. Assuming all conditions for inference are met, which of the following is a 90 percent confidence interval for the difference in population proportions (City C minus City K) who subscribe to the streaming service?

choices.label: <math alttext="open parenthesis, 0.17 minus 0.27, close parenthesis, plus or minus 1.65 times the square root of the fraction, 0.17 over 200, plus the fraction 0.27 over 200, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.17</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.27</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>±</mo><mn>1.65</mn><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.17</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>200</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.27</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>200</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, 0.17 minus 0.27, close parenthesis, plus or minus 1.96 times, the square root of the fraction with numerator, 0.17 times 0.83, plus 0.27 times 0.73, and denominator 400, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.17</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.27</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>±</mo><mn>1.96</mn><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.17</mn><mo>)</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.83</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>0.27</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>0.73</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>400</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 6.8: Confidence Intervals for the Difference of Two Proportions

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Construct a confidence interval, provided conditions for inference are met.
